li.text: -- the editor is an ordinary text field. This is used with view aspects that hold Strings. Sometimes the editor will have been declared as "autostring" which means that changes will be displayed in the associated view directly as you type them. In other situations you must press the Enter key or tab off the editor field to commit the changes.
-- the editor is a check box.
-- the editor displays the colour value. To edit this colour, double-click on the aspect name in the

and the standard system color dialog will appear. Note that this dialog, by default, contains a single entry in the custom colors list. This entry (light grey in appearance) can be used to indicate that you wish to use a default colour for this aspect. An alternative way to set the default colour is to set the aspect value to nil using the
or "Set to Nil" from the Aspect List context menu.
-- the editor displays some text in the given font. To edit this, double-click on the aspect name in the

and the standard system font dialog will be opened. Note, it is not currently possible to use the system font dialog to reset a font aspect to a default value. In order to do this you should select the #
aspect and set its value to nil.

li.text: -- the editor displays a list of the collections elements together with a toolbar to allow these to be re-ordered and deleted.

para.text: In some situations, the aspect will allow new elements to be added, in which case the add button (*) will also be enabled. Click this to add a default new entry to the collection which can then be edited as normal.
